1.text: Pick seed pods from existent cacti or buy commercial seeds.

2.text: If harvesting seeds from cactus pods, gather the pods.

3.text: Next, harvest the seeds from the pods.

4.text: Plant the seeds in high-drainage soil.

5.text: Cover the container and expose it to sun.

6.text: Keep tropical cacti at a steady, warm temperature.

7.text: When the first spines show, allow the plant to ventilate.

8.text: Repot your cacti when they are well-established.

9.text: Allow cacti to recover from repotting in the shade.

11.text: Fertilize young plants during the growing months.

13.text: Gradually increase exposure to sunlight to treat etiolation.

14.text: Avoid phototoxicity by limiting sun exposure after using pesticides.
